update.description:
See issue #9.

The idea of this pull request is to use a new environment variable `IGN_RELAY` to bridge two or more networks and being able to send/receive discovery messages.

The best way to test it is to generate the documentation and follow the new tutorial.
update.title: Relay

content.raw: Changed to `default` as we still don't have `ign-transport7`.
content.html: Changed to default as we still don't have ign-transport7.

update.title: Relay

content.raw: I added a change to the discovery wire protocol that is not compatible with the previous version. The change will cause to parse the header incorrectly, so we cannot relay in the `version` field present in the header.
content.html: I added a change to the discovery wire protocol that is not compatible with the previous version. The change will cause to parse the header incorrectly, so we cannot relay in the version field present in the header.

content.raw: Added a more verbose comment in [705512a](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/commits/705512aedf1dd12f3c63a1196ea4924c13283df6?at=default).
content.html: Added a more verbose comment in 705512a.
Yes, I mean host, thanks. b07bb7c
Removed the --privileged and the nvidia runtime. 47705c9

content.raw:
`--privileged` is a security risk, as is exposing the host X server. I think it prevents the container from being isolated from the host system.

Is nvidia-docker really necessary for this Dockerfile?
content.html:
--privileged is a security risk, as is exposing the host X server. I think it prevents the container from being isolated from the host system.

Is nvidia-docker really necessary for this Dockerfile?

content.raw: Do you mean "Back on your host" instead of "Back to your guest"?
content.html: Do you mean "Back on your host" instead of "Back to your guest"?

content.raw: Can you add more prose documentation to this? I think it's a critical block, but it's a bit hard to understand what's going on.
content.html: Can you add more prose documentation to this? I think it's a critical block, but it's a bit hard to understand what's going on.

content.raw: I was told that we shouldn't use `--privileged`...not sure why though.
content.html: I was told that we shouldn't use --privileged...not sure why though.
